operations.summary: Returns a list of all Log Field Mapping objects

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SCIM filter

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies a property value by which to sort

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Specifies either ascending or descending alphabetical order

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to return

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Indicates the number of results per page

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

responseMessages.message: The requested operation succeeded
The requested operation succeeded and no further information has been provided, such as in the case of a DELETE operation.
The request contents are incorrectly formatted or the request was made for an invalid API version.
The requester cannot be authenticated
The requester does not have the required privileges or another constraint failed, such as attempting to delete an edit-only object.
The requested path does not refer to an existing object or object relation.

The requested operation could not be performed due to the current state of the configuration. For example, an attempt was made to create an object that already exists or an attempt was made to delete an object that is referred to by another object.
The request is such that the Accept header does not indicate that JSON is an acceptable format for a response.
The server encountered an unexpected error.

operations.summary: Add a new Log Field Mapping to the config

parameters.description: Log Field Mapping to add
parameters.name: add-log-field-mapping-request
attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

parameters.name: applyChangeTo
parameters.description: Specify whether to apply this configuration change to a single server or the whole server group. This does not apply to mirrored subtree objects

operations.summary: Update an existing Log Field Mapping by name, replacing any attributes specified in the request body

parameters.description: Specify whether to apply this configuration change to a single server or the whole server group. This does not apply to mirrored subtree objects

add-log-field-mapping-request.description: A Log Field Mapping resource request

mappingName.description: Name of the new Log Field Mapping

logFieldAuthenticationFailureID.description: The numeric identifier for the authentication failure reason.

logFieldRequestedAttributes.description: The set of requested attributes for the search operation.

logFieldTargetProtocol.description: The protocol used when forwarding the request to a backend server.

logFieldSourceAddress.description: The address of the client from which the connection was established.

logFieldScope.description: The scope for the search operation.

logFieldMessageType.description: The type of log message. Message types may include

logFieldStartupid.description: The startup ID for the Directory Server. A different value will be generated each time the server is started, and it may be used to distinguish between operations with the same connection ID and operation ID across server restarts.

logFieldRequestControls.description: The OIDs of the request controls returned to the client.

logFieldNewSuperiorDN.description: The new superior DN from a modify DN operation.

logFieldRequesterDN.description: The DN of the user that requested the operation.

logFieldReferralUrls.description: The referral URLs returned to the client.

logFieldMessageID.description: The message ID included in the client request.

logFieldProductName.description: The name for this Directory Server product, which may be used to identify which product was used to log the message if multiple products log to the same database table.

logFieldAlternateAuthorizationDN.description: The DN of the alternate authorization identity used when processing the operation.

logFieldSASLMechanismName.description: The name of the SASL mechanism used to authenticate.

logFieldNewRDN.description: The new RDN to use for a modify DN operation.

logFieldProtocolName.description: The name of the protocol the client is using to communicate with the Directory Server.

logFieldAuthenticatedUserDN.description: The DN of the user that authenticated to the server.

logFieldRequestOID.description: The OID of an extended request.

logFieldResponseControls.description: The OIDs of the response controls returned to the client.

logFieldTargetHost.description: The address of the server to which the request has been forwarded.

logFieldTimestamp.description: The time that the operation was processed.

logFieldSeverity.description: The severity for the log message.

logFieldDeleteOldRDN.description: Indicates whether the old RDN values should be removed from an entry while processing a modify DN operation.

logFieldInstanceName.description: A name that uniquely identifies this Directory Server instance, which may be used to identify which instance was used to log the message if multiple server instances log to the same database table.

logFieldBindDN.description: The bind DN for a bind operation.

logFieldTargetAddress.description: The network address of the Directory Server to which the client connection has been established.

logFieldIntermediateClientResult.description: The contents of the intermediate client response control returned to the client.

logFieldIntermediateClientRequest.description: The contents of the intermediate client request control provided by the client.

logFieldRequesterIPAddress.description: The IP address of the client that requested the operation.

logFieldResponseOID.description: The OID of an extended response.

logFieldProcessingTime.description: The length of time (in milliseconds with microsecond accuracy) required to process the operation.

description.description: A description for this Log Field Mapping

logFieldTargetPort.description: The network port of the Directory Server to which the client connection has been established, or of the backend server to which the request has been forwarded.

logFieldTargetAttribute.description: The name of the attribute targeted by a compare operation.

logFieldBaseDN.description: The base DN for a search operation.

logFieldAuthenticationType.description: The type of authentication requested by the client.

logFieldEntriesReturned.description: The number of search result entries returned to the client.

logFieldAuthenticationFailureReason.description: A message explaining the reason that the authentication attempt failed.

logFieldMatchedDN.description: The DN of the superior entry closest to the DN specified by the client.

logFieldMessage.description: The diagnostic message for the operation.

logFieldMessageIDToAbandon.description: The message ID of the operation to be abandoned.

logFieldCategory.description: The category for the log message.

logFieldOperationID.description: The operation ID for the operation processed by the server.

logFieldOperationType.description: The type of operation that was processed.

logFieldUnindexed.description: Indicates whether the requested search operation was unindexed.

logFieldResultCode.description: The numeric result code for the operation.

logFieldOrigin.description: The origin for the operation. Values may include
(if the operation was received via replication),
(if it was an internal operation processed by a server component), or
(if it was a request from a client).

logFieldFilter.description: The filter from a search operation.

logFieldAdditionalInformation.description: Additional information about the operation that was processed which was not returned to the client.

logFieldConnectionID.description: The connection ID assigned to the client connection.

logFieldDisconnectReason.description: The reason that the client connection was closed.

logFieldEntryDN.description: The DN of the entry targeted by the operation.

logFieldProtocolVersion.description: The protocol version used by the client when communicating with the Directory Server.
